description.title: airbag and pretensioners : precautions for the repair

descmetadata.siename: airbag and pretensioners : precautions for the repair

noteR.para: All operations on airbag and pretensioner systems must be carried out by qualified trained personnel.
The airbags have a pyrotechnic gas generator with an ignition module and inflatable bag which must not be separated.
The pretensioners have a pyrotechnic gas generator and an igniter which must, under no circumstances, be separated.
Never handle the pyrotechnic systems (pretensioners or airbags) near to a source of heat or naked flame - they may be triggered.
To avoid any splashes, do not place anything in the airbag deployment area.
To prevent the any component from being thrown upwards, store the airbag with the inflatable cushion facing upwards.
If the airbag computer on a hybrid or electric vehicle is locked following an impact, refer to the fault finding procedure for a "Traction battery from a vehicle involved in an impact".

introduction.para: Protect the side impact sensors (with cardboard and adhesive, for example) during an operation near these sensors (risk of damage caused by a falling tool, etc.).
It is essential to replace any pyrotechnic system that has fallen on the ground or shows signs of impact.
It is essential to replace any restraint system that shows deterioration (tears or damage to the strap, damaged appearance parts, cover unclipped, damaged clips or indexing brackets, etc.).

description.title: Procedure for deactivating and activating the safety systems

noteR.para: DANGER : Risk of serious injuries due to the short-circuiting or the untimely triggering of an electrical system (pyrotechnical parts, windscreen wiper motor, electric fan, etc.) following possible loopback of the 12-volt supply circuit by the voltage transformer.
Please adhere to the instructions regarding cut-off of the 12-volt supply circuit.

If the procedure fails, do not continue with your task and ask an employee who is qualified and authorised to work on a high-voltage onboard network to perform fault finding vehicle: precautions for the repairGIEMR-002446.

descbody.para: The pyrotechnic systems (airbags and pretensioners) must be checked using theDiagnostic tool:

ul.li: following theft or attempted theft of the vehicle,

descbody.para: After detection of an impact, the airbag computer is permanently locked and the "Airbag fault" warning light appears on the instrument panel. The airbag computer and the side impact sensors must always be replaced.

noteR.para: If the airbag computer on a hybrid or electric vehicle is locked following an impact, refer to the fault finding procedure for a "Traction battery from a vehicle involved in an impact".
To eliminate the risk of any accident, do not reuse pyrotechnic components.
It is essential to destroy pretensioners or airbags before scrapping a vehicle or a part onlyairbag and pretensioners : recycling - destructionGIEMR-000005.

If an airbag is deployed while the associated seat is not occupied, there is no need to systematically replace the seat's entire frame (seatback only). If the seat was occupied, the entire frame must be replaced.

descbody.para: The precautions which recommended that pyrotechnic components (airbags and pretensioners) were replaced 10 years after the registration of the vehicle have now been lifted.
Pyrotechnic components (airbags and pretensioners) do not therefore require any maintenance.
